name: Salmon Teriyaki Bowl
description: Japanese-style teriyaki glazed salmon. Rich in omega-3 with a perfect sweet-savory balance.

instructions.instruction: Cook rice with 2 cups water for 15-18 minutes.
Make teriyaki sauce: Whisk soy sauce, mirin, honey, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger.
instructions.tip: Sauce can be made ahead and stored for 2 weeks.

instructions.instruction: Pat salmon dry with paper towels. Season lightly with salt.
Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Place salmon skin-side up. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
Flip and cook skin-side down for 2 minutes.
Pour half the teriyaki sauce over salmon. Cook until glazed, about 2 minutes.
instructions.tip: Spoon sauce over salmon as it cooks.

instructions.instruction: Cook edamame according to package directions.
Divide rice into bowls. Arrange salmon, edamame, cucumber, and avocado.
Drizzle remaining sauce, sprinkle sesame seeds.

tips: Salmon is rich in omega-3 fatty acids for brain and heart health.
Mirin can be replaced with rice wine + honey.
Perfect for meal prep - keeps for 3 days.
storageInfo: Store salmon and rice together for up to 3 days. Add fresh avocado when serving.
servingSuggestion: Serve with pickled ginger and wasabi.
variations: Add sriracha mayo for spicy version.
